page.title: 07Wellington College
page.content: The College has also been visited by{King Edward VII, Queen Elizabeth II {and Prince Philip the Duke of {Edinburgh.}The Reading room was restored in 1949 in memory of Wellingtonians who lost their lives in the{World Wars.}There is a display of memorabilia in a case. There are{800 {pupils in 1985, 750 boys and 50 girls, there are still some children who are orphans, these are called {Foundationeers.}The College has a large influence on the area, the grounds extend to 460 acres and are used by the public, the theatre, swimming pool and leisure facilities are also used. The railway station was originally called{Wellington College {Station. The Crowthorne C of E School {and New Scotland Hill School}were both built on Wellington College land.
